projectPurpose: To provide a user-friendly, cross-platform Graphical User Interface (GUI) for the Clash network proxy tool, enabling users to manage and configure proxy settings, profiles, and providers with advanced features and a modern design.
mainFeatures: Built-in support for multiple Clash cores (Clash Premium, Mihomo & Clash Rust)
Profiles management and enhancement (by YAML, JavaScript & Lua)
Google Material You Design UI and animation support

alternatives.name: Clash Verge Rev
mainFeatures: Uses the latest Clash Meta (mihomo) kernel
Enhanced management of configuration files (YAML, JavaScript)
Simple and beautiful interface design with customizable themes
Integrated system proxy settings and guard functions

alternatives.name: V2RayN
mainFeatures: V2Ray client based on V2Ray, Singbox, and other cores
Supports VLESS, Shadowsocks, and other protocols

alternatives.name: Nekoray
mainFeatures: Supports multiple protocols (SOCKS, HTTP, SS, VMess, VLESS, Trojan, TUIC, NaïveProxy, Hysteria2)

alternatives.name: v2rayA
mainFeatures: Web GUI client for Project V
Supports VMess, VLESS, SS, SSR, Trojan, Tuic and Juicity protocols
Supports global transparent proxy on Linux

alternatives.name: Proxifier
mainFeatures: Proxy any application regardless of its own proxy support
Lightweight and flexible alternative to VPN

marketPositioning: Clash Nyanpasu is positioned as a modern, actively maintained, and feature-rich cross-platform GUI client specifically for the Clash ecosystem. It differentiates itself through its support for multiple Clash cores, extensive profile and scripting capabilities (YAML, JavaScript, Lua), and a focus on a polished user interface with Google Material You Design. It serves users who prefer the Clash rule-based proxy system and seek a powerful, customizable, and aesthetically pleasing desktop application, standing out from older or less actively developed Clash GUIs and offering a Clash-centric alternative to clients for other proxy protocols.
